meanings.definition: To break down into simpler substances
meanings.sent1: Leaves in the forest are slowly decomposing into soil.
meanings.sent2: The old fruit was decomposing in the compost bin.
meanings.sent3: The scientist's experiment involved decomposing various chemicals.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to decompose the memories into fragments.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes decomposed the image into abstract shapes.

meanings.sent1: The fallen tree was decomposing on the forest floor.
meanings.sent2: The food left out for days started decomposing and smelled bad.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten sandwich was decomposing in the lunchbox.
meanings.sent4: Neglect can slowly decompose relationships over time.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house was slowly decomposing into ruins.

meanings.definition: The process of breaking down organic matter
meanings.sent1: Composting is a natural form of decomposing organic waste.
meanings.sent2: The decomposing of leaves in the forest helps enrich the soil.
meanings.sent3: The classroom had a bin dedicated to the decomposing of food scraps.
meanings.sent4: The decomposition of plants in the garden creates nutrients for new growth.
meanings.sent5: The smell in the kitchen was due to the ongoing decomposing of food.
